article.headline: Elon University 77, Wofford 64
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. (AP) -- Jackson Atoyebi scored 22 points and grabbed 14 rebounds to lead Elon to a 77-64 victory against Wofford on Saturday. The Phoenix (7-13, 3-5) won their second straight Southern Conference game as they controlled the boards. Elon outrebounded Wofford by a 46-21 advantage, including 21-3 on the offensive end. The Terriers (6-13, 2-6) opened the game with a 14-4 run before the Phoenix stormed back to take a 42-32 halftime lead. A jumper by Ryan Jones gave Elon the lead for good at 26-25 with 5:56 to play in the first half. It also began an 18-5 Phoenix run that was keyed by eight points from Scottie Rice, who finished the game with 12 points. Elon scored the first 12 points of the second half to build a 22-point lead at 54-32 with 17:18 to play. The Phoenix increased their lead to 23 points before Sam Daniels keyed a Wofford run with eight points in a 2:08 span as the Terriers cut the deficit to 61-48 with 12:20 remaining. However, Elon scored the next six points to pull away. Daniels topped Wofford with 13 points, all in the second half. Howard Wilkerson added 12 points and a team-best five rebounds to go with four assists.
